titleStmt.title: An electronic transcription of Kaufmann MS A50 of the Mishnah
titleStmt.sponsor: Joseph and Rebecca Meyerhoff Center for Jewish Studies
Lieberman Institute; Primary Witnesses to Tannaitic Literature

publicationStmt.pubPlace: The Maryland Institute for Technology in the Humanities

availability.p: This work is copyright Hayim Lapin and the Joseph and Rebecca Meyerhoff Center for Jewish Studies and licensed under a .

note.p: The Kaufmann Manuscript of the Mishnah(MS A 50, Oriental Collection of the Library of the Hungarian Academy of Sciences)
Transcriptions based on images available at http://kaufmann.mtak.hu/en/ms50/ms50-coll1.htm
Premilinary transcription provided by the Lieberman Institute, and corrected and marked up by Atara Siegel. Supercedes Kauf.xml, transcribed by Justin Orr and marked up by Hayim Lapin

msIdentifier.repository: Library of the Hungarian Academy of Sciences

layout.note: Dimensions based on Gergely catalog and personal communication by Balazs Tamasi, of the Library of the Hungarian Academy of Sciences

handNote.note: Second hand points the text using the Babylonian vocalization than first scribe.

w.note: deletion of space between בת and שילומים is implicit.

ab.label: ד׳
ab.w: לירבוץPossibly shewa under lamed, and hiriq under yod.
ab.label: ה׳
ג׳
ab.w: כליםLetters are run in; possibly אוכלים, in error
ab.label: ד׳
ד׳
ab.w: Possibly the correction קשו is deleted as well. ואת

ab.label: י׳ד׳
י׳ה׳
י׳ו׳
י׳ז׳
ab.w: היזיקPossibly this is a spot on the parchment.

ab.label: ב׳
ab.w: לגדוליםPossibly, damage is erasure of daggesh to be replaced with rafeh.

ab.label: ה׳
ab.w: ́Possibly "damage" represents removal of dagesh in ת.

w.note: Text of the Academy of the Hebrew Language reads כ for the correction

ab.label: ד׳
ab.w: את Strikethrough on את is faint.
חייב Overline on העצים is faint.
ab.label: ה׳
ו׳

w.note: Appears to have been vocalized בגדים. After removal of ים, vocalization partially erased?

ab.label: ג
ab.w: לאו לאThe edition of the Academy for the Hebrew Language marks this as deletion, rather than damage.
יישבעTranscriber suspected that second yod is deleted.

ab.label: ז׳
ab.w: עבדים Possible traces of correction at עב?

w.note: Waw converted to yod by second hand.

ab.label: ז׳
ab.w:
ואחר
ד
Corrects dalet to resh.

w.note: Possibly an error or a spot on the parchment.

ab.label: יא׳
ab.w: זה ו Corrects heh to waw.

ab.label: יב׳
ab.w: ועליךUnderscore under word; ink matches that of pointing.

ab.label: ד׳
ab.w: ? או have perhaps also been altered.

ab.label: ב׳
ab.w: אין Insertion mark only. Correction implied.

ab.label: ד׳
ab.w: אמר Insertion mark only. Comment implied.לו

ab.label: ד׳

w.note: Small hole in writing surface. No characters are missing.

ab.w: זה ו ה converted to ו.
ab.label: ה׳

w.note: Small hole in writing surface. No characters are missing.
Waw is transformed by later scribe into yod.
Final nun is overwritten with final mem.

ab.label: ה׳
ab.w: בשעת ה ת converted to ה.

w.note: Punctuation mark possibly intended for the end of the preceding line.

ab.label: ו׳
ab.w: או י ו converted into י.נן

ab.label: י׳ג׳
ab.w: כתובת ה The ת is converted into a ה.

w.note: Waw is partially scratched to convert it into a yod.
